medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital features including significant respiratory obstruction requiring tracheostomy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a newborn female, presented with micrognathia, cleft palate, and retroglossoptosis. These features were severe enough to cause significant respiratory obstruction that required tracheostomy from birth.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents do not have microdeletions or clinical signs of FEVR; the patient is an only child, and no other family members are known to have retinopathy.
